intro: Amyris macrocarpa, commonly known as the broadleaf sandarac or swamp sandarac, is a flowering plant in the family Oleaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture. Amyris macrocarpa is often found in wetlands and along waterways, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
